entry.title: é€’å½’
entry.content:
é€’å½’æ¨¡æ¿ï¼Œè®°ä½é€’å½’æ˜¯å¯¹æ¯ä¸€å±‚åšçš„æ“ä½œ

é¢˜ç›®1ï¼šäºŒå‰æ ‘çš„æœ€å¤§æ·±åº¦

# Definition for a binary tree node.
# class TreeNode:
#     def __init__(self, x):
#         self.val = x
#         self.left = None
#         self.right = None

class Solution:
    def maxDepth(self, root: TreeNode) -> int:
        if not root:
            return 0
        ldepth = self.maxDepth(root.left) + 1 
        rdepth = self.maxDepth(root.right) + 1
        return max(ldepth, rdepth)

å¯ä»¥æŠŠåˆ¤æ–­å¶å­èŠ‚ç‚¹å»æ‰çš„åŸå› ï¼Œå¯ä»¥å¤šèµ°ä¸€å±‚èµ°åˆ°å¶å­èŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸‹ä¸€å±‚å‘ç°æ²¡æœ‰å°±è¿”å›ä¸Šæ¥0ã€‚æ¯èµ°ä¸€å±‚å°±åŠ 1ï¼Œèµ°åˆ°å¶å­èŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸‹ä¸€å±‚ï¼Œè¿”å›0 +1 ä¹Ÿæ˜¯ä¸€æ ·çš„ã€‚

å®˜æ–¹è§£æ³•ï¼Œæ¯å¾€ä¸‹èµ°ä¸€å±‚å°±+1ï¼Œ ç„¶åæ¯å±‚å–å·¦å³ä¸¤è¾¹æœ€å¤§çš„æ·±åº¦

class Solution:
    def maxDepth(self, root):
        """
        :type root: TreeNode
        :rtype: int
        """ 
        if root is None: 
            return 0 
        else: 
            left_height = self.maxDepth(root.left) 
            right_height = self.maxDepth(root.right) 
            return max(left_height, right_height) + 1

åˆ é™¤ï¼Œå»ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå¤§äºparent nodeçš„èŠ‚ç‚¹ã€‚
å¹³å‡ O(log(n)) æœ€å·®æƒ…å†µ O(n)

é¢˜ç›®1ï¼š N å‰æ ‘å‰åºéå†

ç»™å®šä¸€ä¸ª N å‰æ ‘ï¼Œè¿”å›å…¶èŠ‚ç‚¹å€¼çš„å‰åºéå†ã€‚

"""
# Definition for a Node.
class Node:
    def __init__(self, val=None, children=None):
        self.val = val
        self.children = children
"""

class Solution:
    def preorder(self, root: 'Node') -> List[int]:
        path = []
        def traverse(node):
            if node:
                path.append(node.val)
                for n in node.children:
                    traverse(n)
        traverse(root)
        return path

é¢˜ç›®1ï¼š åˆ é™¤æ’åºæ•°ç»„ä¸­çš„é‡å¤é¡¹

è§£æ³•1ï¼šä¸€å¼€å§‹çš„æ€è·¯æ˜¯æŠŠæ•°ç»„å¾ªç¯ä¸€éï¼Œæœ‰é‡å¤çš„å°±åˆ é™¤æ‰ï¼ŒO(n^2) çš„æ•ˆç‡

æ•°ç»„å¾ªç¯åˆ é™¤çš„æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œå¤åˆ¶ä¸€éæ•°ç»„æˆ–è€…ä½¿ç”¨åå‘éå†
ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆåå‘éå†ä¸ä¼šå‡ºç° index çš„é”™è¯¯ï¼Ÿ
This implies that if you iterate the list back to front, if you remove an item at the current index, everything to it's right shifts left - but that doesn't matter, since you've already dealt with all the elements to the right of the current position, and you're moving left - the next element to the left is unaffected by the change, and so the iterator gives you the element you expect.
a b c x d
a b c d

python range
range(start, stop, step)
reverse: range(len(x)-1, -1, -1)

class Solution:
    def removeDuplicates(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        if len(nums) == 1:
            return len(nums)
        for i in range(len(nums)-1,0,-1):
            if nums[i] == nums[i-1]:
                nums.pop(i)
        return len(nums)

è§£æ³•2ï¼š åŒæŒ‡é’ˆ O(n)

ä¸€ä¸ªæŒ‡é’ˆæŒ‡å‘è¦æ”¾ä¸åŒelementçš„ä¸‹æ ‡ï¼Œå¦å¤–ä¸€ä¸ªæŒ‡é’ˆç”¨æ¥æœç´¢ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªè¦æ”¾çš„å…ƒç´ 

class Solution:
    def removeDuplicates(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        i = 0
        for j in range(len(nums)):
            if nums[i] != nums[j]:
                nums[i+1] = nums[j]
                i = i + 1
        return len(nums[:i+1])

class Solution:
    def strStr(self, haystack: str, needle: str) -> int:
        if len(needle) == 0 :
            return 0
        for i in range(len(haystack)):
            if haystack[i : i + len(needle)] == needle:
                return i
        return -1

å…¥é—¨é¢˜2: å­é›†


åˆ†è§£é—®é¢˜ä½¿ç”¨é€’å½’è§£å†³

æˆ‘çš„è§£æ³•ï¼šæŠŠæ‰€æœ‰å¯èƒ½è¿‡ä¸€éï¼Œå»é‡

class Solution:
    def subsets(self, nums) :
        subsets = [[]]
        def subset(nums):
            if len(nums) == 0:
                return
            subsets.append(nums)
            for n in nums:
                nums_copy = nums[:]
                nums_copy.remove(n)
                if nums_copy not in subsets:
                    subset(nums_copy)
            return
        subset(nums)
        return subsets

å®˜æ–¹è§£æ³•1: ä»å°åˆ°å¤§ï¼Œæ¯æ¬¡æœ‰æ–°æ•°å‡ºç°çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼ŒæŠŠä¹‹å‰çš„å¯èƒ½åºåˆ—åˆå¹¶ä¸Šè¿™ä¸ªæ•°

class Solution:
    def subsets(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        n = len(nums)
        output = [[]]
        
        for num in nums:
            output += [curr + [num] for curr in output]
        
        return output
